intro: Cardamine nepalensis, commonly known as the Nepal watercress, is a perennial herb native to the Himalayan region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many edible and economically important plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky crevices. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and often have a peppery aroma. The small white or pink flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom in early spring.
